AD_Dog.synopsis: Scratch the courier's dog barks and growls as you near him, warning you away. Sound effects only.

Dead.synopsis: Using Speak with Dead, we are able to talk to the spirit of Gomwick. He was killed by a band of gnolls, but managed to save his dog, Scratch, by forcing him to flee.

Dog.synopsis:
In SwA, Scratch speaks like a human. He doesn't have any kind of dog-like affectation, nor is he stupid - he's well-spoken, even when he's saying 'dog' things. Throughout the dialogue, he's stoic but heartbroken, deluding himself into believing that his master is not dead.We come across the corpse of a man being protected by his loyal dog, Scratch.The dog refuses to let us near the dead man or his belongings, forcing us to try and win him over (or else just kill him). We can use Speak with Animals to get further insight into the dog's perspective.
 If we cast Speak with Dead upon the courier, we can learn the dog's name and use this as an additional way to win it over.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: When examining the synopses, we notice that the 'Dead' session involves speaking with Gomwick’s spirit, which reveals that his dog, Scratch, was saved by him. The 'Dog' session shows you encountering the corpse of the man while Scratch the dog protects it, and it explicitly mentions that using Speak with Dead (which provides the dog’s name) can help you win Scratch over. This indicates that 'Dead' should happen before 'Dog'. In addition, 'AD_Dog' is described as having only sound effects with the courier’s dog barking and growling, while 'Dog' provides a conversational, more in‐depth encounter with Scratch. Thus, encountering the dog through 'AD_Dog' seems to be an alternate path to engaging with Scratch, meaning that 'AD_Dog' and 'Dog' are mutually exclusive within the same playthrough.

Dead_11.speaker: Narrator
Dead_11.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Dead_14.speaker: Player
Dead_14.text: Why were you in the forest?

Dead_1.speaker: Player
Dead_1.text: Where did you keep the letters?

Dead_24.speaker: Player
Dead_24.text: I've taken Scratch in. Is there anyone I can take him to?

Dead_8.speaker: Gomwick
Dead_8.text: ... we have... no one... only... each other...

Dead_12.speaker: Player
Dead_12.text: I want to help Scratch. How can I calm him?

Dead_16.speaker: Narrator
Dead_16.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Dead_28.speaker: Narrator
Dead_28.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

Dog_22.speaker: Narrator
Dog_22.text: *The dog flashes its teeth in a snarl - he wants you gone.*

Dog_30.speaker: Scratch
Dog_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog sniffs his owner's corpse

Dog_40.speaker: Scratch
Dog_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Snarling, turning to the player

Dog_81.speaker: Player
Dog_81.text: You're Scratch, aren't you? Come here. It's all right.

Dog_69.speaker: Scratch
Dog_69.text: You know my name? Interesting - a predator wouldn't care to learn it.

Dog_11.speaker: Scratch
Dog_11.text: What are you doing? Get back!

Dog_106.speaker: Player
Dog_106.text: If I wanted to hurt either of you, I'd have done it already.

Dog_119.speaker: Player
Dog_119.text: I could snap you in half, if I wanted to. I don't.

Dog_36.speaker: Player
Dog_36.text: You don't want me angry. Trust me - one animal to another.

Dog_39.speaker: Scratch
Dog_39.text: Perhaps that's true. Your scent is thick with blood.

Dog_29.speaker: Scratch
Dog_29.text: Still, you should go. My friend is injured. He needs rest.

Dog_17.speaker: Player
Dog_17.text: I don't think he's going to wake up.

Dog_80.speaker: Scratch
Dog_80.text: Of course he will. And then we'll return home.

Dog_98.speaker: Scratch
Dog_98.text: He calls me Scratch. You can do the same.

Dog_46.speaker: Player
Dog_46.text: What happened to your friend, exactly?

Dog_111.speaker: Scratch
Dog_111.text: We were attacked. Cackling, furry things on two legs.

Dog_86.speaker: Scratch
Dog_86.text: And their smell... it was strange. Rotten. Evil.

Dog_61.speaker: Narrator
Dog_61.text: *You know the creatures he describes - gnolls.*

Dog_91.speaker: Player
Dog_91.text: Come on, you can travel with me if you like.

Dog_87.speaker: Player
Dog_87.text: If he doesn't wake up, follow my scent. I have a camp.

Dog_97.speaker: Scratch
Dog_97.text: If it comes to that... I may. Thank you.

Dog_115.speaker: Player
Dog_115.text: Prove the man is dead - shout at his corpse.

Dog_16.speaker: Scratch
Dog_16.text: Just go. I won't ask you again.

Dog_43.speaker: Player
Dog_43.text: It's noble to protect one of your clan, but he's gone.

Dog_68.speaker: Scratch
Dog_68.text: He's not my clan. He's my friend.

Dog_94.speaker: Player
Dog_94.text: Stop deluding yourself - you are guarding a corpse.

Dog_37.speaker: Scratch
Dog_37.text: Your words are uglier than the rest of you.

Dog_55.speaker: Scratch
Dog_55.text: Go back to whatever hole you slithered out of.

Dog_38.speaker: Player
Dog_38.text: He's with his god now. I'm sorry.

Dog_28.speaker: Scratch
Dog_28.text: It's not over yet. He'll wake up.

Dog_54.speaker: Scratch
Dog_54.text: You snarl, but you have no teeth.

Dog_66.speaker: Player
Dog_66.text: I'm not an enemy, I promise.

Dog_75.speaker: Player
Dog_75.text: Calm, friend. I mean you no harm.

Dog_109.speaker: Player
Dog_109.text: I understand your fear, but I promise I mean you no harm.

Dog_64.speaker: Player
Dog_64.text: Calm yourself. I harm only those deserving of it.

Dog_62.speaker: Scratch
Dog_62.text: Hm. There's death in your scent, but not in your words.

Dog_6.speaker: Scratch
Dog_6.text: These wilds crawl with monsters. You could be one of them.

Dog_48.speaker: Narrator
Dog_48.text: *The dog remains at the dead man's side, as if in mourning.*

Dog_84.speaker: Narrator
Dog_84.text: *The dog watches the corpse, a quiet whine escaping with every breath.*

Dog_95.speaker: Scratch
Dog_95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presenceNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presence

Dog_122.speaker: Player
Dog_122.text: Sidestep him to get to the corpse.

Dog_51.speaker: Scratch
Dog_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog grows more aggressive

Dog_52.speaker: Player
Dog_52.text: It's all right, Scratch. I'm not going to hurt you.

Dog_102.speaker: Narrator
Dog_102.text: *The dog lowers his hackles, his head tilted inquisitively.*
Dog_102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog tilts its head/shows uncertainty.

Dog_58.speaker: Narrator
Dog_58.text: *Convinced that you're harmless, he turns his attention back to the corpse.*
Dog_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog looks to the corpse nearby, barks. The corpse is clearly dead.

Dog_121.speaker: Narrator
Dog_121.text: *With a deep, heartbroken whine, the dog bows his head.*
Dog_121.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog bows its head.

Dog_124.speaker: Narrator
Dog_124.text: *The dog looks at his owner with sad eyes. He does not move.*
Dog_124.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog looks to the corpse nearby, whining. The corpse is clearly dead.

Dog_70.speaker: Narrator
Dog_70.text: *He whines, but remains rooted by the corpse's side.*
Dog_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog looks to the corpse nearby, whining. The corpse is clearly dead.

Dog_100.speaker: Player
Dog_100.text: Hold out your hand so he can follow your scent to camp.

Dog_104.speaker: Narrator
Dog_104.text: *The dog sniffs your hand, his tail swung low in understanding. He knows how to find you.*

Dog_92.speaker: Player
Dog_92.text: Take a closer look at him.

Dog_44.speaker: Narrator
Dog_44.text: *Around his neck is a collar, etched with a name - 'Scratch'.*
Dog_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closer look at the dog's neck (collar/tag doesn't necessarily have to be legible when combined with the narration)

Dog_85.speaker: Player
Dog_85.text: Shake your head - the man is gone.

Dog_33.speaker: Narrator
Dog_33.text: *The dog whimpers nervously, as if to urge you on.*
Dog_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog lets the player pet him (or steps closer into imply this is happening)

Dog_35.speaker: Narrator
Dog_35.text: *You see a name etched into the leather - 'Scratch'.*
Dog_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closer look at the dog's neck (collar/tag doesn't necessarily have to be legible when combined with the narration)

Dog_56.speaker: Scratch
Dog_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to look at the corpse.NodeContext: Dog whining.

Dog_1.speaker: Scratch
Dog_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns and yaps at the corpse, as if to try to wake it.

Dog_101.speaker: Scratch
Dog_101.text: Go on. If he doesn't wake... I'll find you.
